Build: I20050315

I can consistently get a StackOverflowError by doing the following:

1) Start with the following code:

	public void foo() {
		Object[] array = new Object[0];

	}

2) With the cursor on the empty second line of the method, type "for".
3) When code assist pops up, hit enter to select the for loop template
4) Without moving the cursor, type "if("
5) Now hit Ctrl+Z.

Stack overflow.  See log file for full ouput.  Here is the top of the stack:
